update.description:
Added some basic support for sending events from the sim back to the portal. Currently the simulation will send events on each of the statuses (READY, RUNNING, FINISHING, FINISHED, and SENDING LOGS).

Dev note: The events module is basically an events queue that will try to send those events to a configured url. The process will get the latest value from that url , extend it using current event data, and send the updated data back to the url (ie. the portal)

This is ready for review. @iche033 could you please take a look ?
update.title: Support callbacks from cloudsim-sim to portal

pull_request.title: Support callbacks from cloudsim-sim to portal

pullrequest.title: Support callbacks from cloudsim-sim to portal

content.raw:
Thanks @iche033  ! 
Also, regarding your question: 

```
#!python

do you think we should avoid overwriting existing simulation data in portal with PUT? We could then avoid doing an extra GET and then extending the data.
```
I followed that approach to allow clients to send only the data they are interesting in (or know about), without requiring all clients to keep the full status of the sim. In other words I find it somewhat dangerous to let any client override the entire status. I believe statuses could come from different places (eg. some clients are interested in sending statuses like ready, running, stopped , while others will need to send score stats) .
If we agree to follow this idea, and in order to avoid the need for 2 requests, we could update portal code to do this logic of 'extending' current status with the received data. What do you think? 

 Thanks again!
content.html:
Thanks @iche033 ! Also, regarding your question: 

do you think we should avoid overwriting existing simulation data in portal with PUT? We could then avoid doing an extra GET and then extending the data.

I followed that approach to allow clients to send only the data they are interesting in (or know about), without requiring all clients to keep the full status of the sim. In other words I find it somewhat dangerous to let any client override the entire status. I believe statuses could come from different places (eg. some clients are interested in sending statuses like ready, running, stopped , while others will need to send score stats) . If we agree to follow this idea, and in order to avoid the need for 2 requests, we could update portal code to do this logic of 'extending' current status with the received data. What do you think?

Thanks again!
